text:
Dear NAEB Region II Member:
Is it cold where you are? Are you shoveling snow? Have you been
longing for an opportunity to visit in warmer climes?
Here’s your chance for a generous helping of that wonderful sun¬
shine and, at the same time, a stimulating meeting with your
fellow workers.•.the 1963 NAEB Region II Conference to be held
at the fabulous International Inn in beautiful Tampa on Florida1s
Sun Coast. G> C£*j-rK_rt^
Enclosed youfll find a preliminary program, reservation forms from
the International Inn, literature from the Chamber of Commerce to
warm the cockles of your heart and attached—a form to send back
to us today that you1re planning to attend.
We don’t need your money—yet, but we do need to know that you are
coming. You can pay us the #12 registration fee when you arrive,
receiving in exchange therefor three gourmet meals, a rousing
hospitality hour, many exciting conference speakers and the op¬
portunity to exchange ideas and information with educational
broadcasters from all over the South.
You’ll find two forms enclosed: first, your Conference registration
to be returned to WEDU; second, your room reservation, to be sent
direct to the International Inn. The Inn has established a special
conference rate of #9 single, #12 double, including, of course, all
pool privileges. What we need to know now is, will you be with us
on March 29 and 30? We sincerely hope the answer will be a prompt
and resounding YES!
Cordially and sincerely.
Julia Sadd
Public Relations
Business Affairs
